Yesterday I constructed an extremely primitive and extremely loud drum-set out of a 55-gallon metal oil barrel and two heavy sticks.  (The water cooler jug, used previously, was destroyed by my violent music.)  The devastating primordial reverberations communicate eternal truths.

“In just a few moments I would meet my first primitive man. Would he like me? I desperately wanted him to.

I envisaged 125 social facts running about altruistically calling each other kinship terms and sharing food, each anxious to be studied by me.”

Shocking statistics on mental health in Econ PhD programs:

- 18% would be classified as depressed
- Over two week period, 11% students had suicidal thoughts. Of which, 26% thought had above-average mental health
- Depression and anxiety symptoms comparable to prisoners

quote.text:
Landmark mental health study of graduate students in economics by Paul Barreira, Matthew Basilico, and @vbolotnyy is now posted: https://scholar.harvard.edu/files/bolotnyy/files/bbb_mentalhealth_paper.pdf …

Incredibly thankful of the efforts by these authors and all involved in the study that made it possible.
